meanings.sent1: The old textbook was uncurrent, with information that was no longer accurate.
meanings.sent2: Her uncurrent knowledge of technology made it difficult for her to use the new software.
meanings.sent3: The uncurrent calendar still showed dates from last year, causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: His uncurrent understanding of the situation led to misunderstandings with his colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The uncurrent map misled hikers with outdated trails and landmarks.

meanings.sent1: The torn bill was uncurrent and could not be accepted by the cashier.
meanings.sent2: The counterfeit coins were uncurrent and were quickly identified by the bank teller.
meanings.sent3: Trying to use uncurrent currency at the store resulted in raised eyebrows from the cashier.
meanings.sent4: His uncurrent banknotes were rejected by the vending machine, causing inconvenience.
meanings.sent5: The uncurrent coins were kept as souvenirs rather than spent in the market.
